In 1999, the Vermont Supreme Court said that it's unconstitutional under the Vermont constitution to discriminate against lesbian and gay couples.
Now, the court then left it to the legislature to define the remedy.
And the legislature in the year 2000 adopted the civil union statute.
Then the people had an opportunity to vote for and against the legislators who adopted that statute.
Some were defeated, most were reelected.
We had experience in Vermont with civil unions.
Lesbian and gay couples, many of them raising children, many of them neighbors, teachers, co-workers, et cetera, entered into solemn and celebrated unions.
